website_summaries.verdict: Generous size and open spaces give baby plenty of places to grab this intriguing, flexible rattle.
pros: Interesting cluster of wooden dowels, balls, and elastic ties
Returns to its original shape after play
Provides visual stimulation and a chance to build motor skills
Multiple color options in non-toxic finishes
Recommended from birth, but best for 4 months and older
cons: We recommend inspecting toy before each use
Occasional reports of splintering near the dowel edges and fraying of elastic

website_summaries.verdict: Unique design makes for a great wooden toy for the youngest of children.
pros: Movable wood balls and elastic keep babies engaged
cons: Some babies have hit themselves in the head with it while pulling on the elastic bands

customer_reviews.title: I liked it because my little one was very preoccupied with ...inspect before use
customer_reviews.text: It's nothing really special. I liked it because my little one was very preoccupied with suckling on the endings of the toy while on "tummy time". It got him to stay occupied enough to break his time on his belly. I think as he grows into it, he would have more fun with squishing the toy and respond to the noise it makes from the inner bulbs hitting the wood pegs. Once major concern is that there is a little splinter sticking out where the ball meets the stick. It seems to be glossed over, but I will be sanding it down and more-podging it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Ulyana N

customer_reviews.title: A couple issues.
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, I was shocked to see it was not sturdy and held in place. It’s held together by bungee type cords and if you step on it will will flatten. I hope that makes sense. Secondly, my baby cut her lip on it somehow. I was sitting right there with her when. Happened. Baby was chewing away on the end and then she looked up and me in pain and cried. Sure enough, baby had a slice on inside of lip! I’ve been hesitant to get it out since. It’s cute. And colorful. And it’s neat how the beads move.
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: Good for older babies with control of their hands
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves this toy! I got it when he turned 4 months and he immediately grabbed for it. He likes squishing it and putting it in his mouth but we have to watch him carefully because he gets excited and starts banging it. He’s hit himself a couple of times with it but just stops briefly and keeps going. I’m sure he’ll love this a few months down as well when he can figure out not to hit his face.
customer_reviews.author: Rororo

customer_reviews.title: Classic winner!
customer_reviews.text: Babies and toddlers enjoy this toy. This is my go-to baby shower or "1st Birthday" gift. I bought these for my children when they were toddlers (late 1980's). Back then the toy had metal bells in addition to the wooden beads. The bells were probably discontinued due to product safety and liability concerns. The current version of this toy is still a joy. Bright colors, squishy movement, sliding beads... what's not to like? I like it, too. The geometry and symmetry appeal to me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mcclure

customer_reviews.title: My 3 month old LOVES this!
customer_reviews.text: I found this toy in an attempt to keep the toys for my daughter simple, no loud noises and lights. My 3 month old LOVES this toy! She has been completely enthralled with it since she was about 2 months old. She loves the colors and watching the wooden balls slide up and down the strings. She is just starting to be able to grasp it with her hands. I think this will entertain her for many more months to come!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: This is our second skwish. I was given one as a gift with my first baby and it was a favorite of my first two babies. It disappeared in a move so we ordered another for our third babe for Christmas. It's easy for very young babies to grab and play with. They loved chewing on it and the sliding balls made a soothing sound. The bright colors are also engaging. I admit, when I first opened it I wasn't to impressed but watching my kids love it and play with it changed my mind. A great gift for baby!
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: The best.  Watch out for teething and chewing off paint.
customer_reviews.text: The best infant toy ever! you can also hang it (add a string or rubber band) for looking at like a mobile. Our infant was enthralled with this as something to look at and later, to hold. Once he had teeth, he was chewing on it and scraping some of the paint off! So perhaps not for teething kiddos. We also bought the natural wood version...safer for chewers! Best toy!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: We have it and the Winkle out pretty much every day
customer_reviews.text: This toy seemed a little pricy, but so far has been one of my sons favorites. We have it and the Winkle out pretty much every day. When he was new, he liked to hear the noise it made when we shook it for him. The shape made it one of the first toys he was able to grab and manipulate.
customer_reviews.author: Kaysha

customer_reviews.title: Coolest baby toy ever
customer_reviews.text: I would give this a hundred stars if I could. I bought this (classic colored) for my son who just turned 2 months old so I did not expect this to be useful for a little while. But man his face light ups already when he sees this thing and he tries to grab it. Its amazing. I am really enjoying playing with it too lol wish I had bought these for my first two kids for sure. It’s well made, squishes nice, and makes a cool little decor piece when not it use!
customer_reviews.author: Tori and Cole

customer_reviews.title: Dye rubs off!
customer_reviews.text: When I took it out of the box I noticed the dye rubbed off onto the sides of the box. I wiped the toy with a wet paper towel and some of the dye came off on the towel. Since my 6mo will put it in my mouth I don’t feel that it’s safe to give him. I’m not sure I can trust this company’s products anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It provided countless hours of enjoyment, and we are confident this new one will ...
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased one in 1993 for our first baby daughter. It survived 2 more children after that! Finally, the elastic string that holds the sticks in suspension gave out. When our grandson came along, it was the first toy we though of to give as a gift. It is virtually indestructible to babies and young children. It provided countless hours of enjoyment, and we are confident this new one will also. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: h. johnson

customer_reviews.title: Intriguing yet simple
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Christmas for my 6 month old, it kept his interest quite well. He does tend to clack himself in the face with it when he's shaking it, which results in him crying, so just watch your littles when in use. Otherwise the colors are so vivid and bright, the sound of the sliding beads is soothing, and everyone likes squishing it and watching it bounce back. Overall good classic toy for baby.
customer_reviews.author: FryIvy

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase for parents looking for a thought provoking interactive nonplastic toy.
customer_reviews.text: This toy is a great choice for purposeful parents looking for thought provoking interactive nonplastic toys for there children. My little guy loves rattling it for now. Other children that visit also enjoy playing with it and parents always comment on it. A great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: E Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, Sturdy Toy
customer_reviews.text: We got the Skwish at the recommendation of friends and their babies. We love that's it's wood, bright colors, and has such a gentle rattle sound. Baby learned to grasp on this early, but has even more fun teething on it, shaking it and rolling it as he has gotten older. This is a toy that can grow with baby, my friend's older kids like to play with it when they visit too.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality product! Great for motor skill development:)
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! Very soft wood! I definitely trust in my baby’s mouth which is of course inevitable for anything in arms reach! I love the colors and the sound of the rattle is beautiful and soft. Reminds me of a wood wind chime at the beach! So beautiful! I love that stretchy string is used for grabbing!
customer_reviews.author: Siena

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Saw this in an article about great all-in-one toys, and he's loved it since day one. We got this for him when he was around 2.5-3 months old and he really just kind of looked at it, now he's almost six months, and it's one of his favorites. Whether he's just shaking it so it makes noise, or constantly chewing on it, he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what it is, but baby loves this toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple toy, but it continues to draw baby's attention even more than other toys. Baby first played with this toy at a friend's house and then I decided to buy one for Christmas. I'm really not sure what the draw is, but baby loves this toy . It's easy to grasp, easy to attach to the plastic rings to keep it attached to a stroller or seat. It is a fun tactile experience and is really nice to squish.
customer_reviews.author: theUncraftyMama

customer_reviews.title: My son is obsessed with this
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be a present for my son for his first birthday but I took it out of the box to inspect and he has been obsessed with it. He loves the sliding round blocks and the springy stretchy ropes. All edges of mine were smooth and sanded. I was worried about that. I hope it will stand up to my teething 11 month old!! Will update after he’s used it awhile!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Sounds pretty!
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound this toy makes. It's soo much better than the traditional baby rattle these days. The toy itself is a good quality and very cute. However, i really wish my 7 month old was more interested in it. I really like it, but she didn't even acknowledge it 30 seconds after I gave it to her 😕
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: This toy is amazing. It is so easy for tiny hands to ...
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 mo baby just started swatting her hands at objects. I thought it would be weeks more before she could pick up, grasp, and manipulate objects by herself. Enter the Skwish. This toy is amazing. It is so easy for tiny hands to grab or get stuck in. My child cannot get enough of this and the Winkle toy by the same company. They are the only toys she can easily pick up and hold by herself.
customer_reviews.author: GHD

customer_reviews.title: A playpen must!
customer_reviews.text: The springy, light and flexible form is easy for infants to pick up and manipulate. The sound from the beads and sticks sliding and clacking is both stimulating and soothing. Like a rain stick or bamboo wood chime. Even when your little one flails it wildly it still sounds pleasing. We tested all connections and all are sturdy and unbreakable by us or an infant. We even taste tested the wood and paint- no foul taste, no taste at all, no flaking or loss of paint or glossy coating. When our child grows tired of it, it's still a very interesting and almost scientific/atomic piece of sculpture for his shelf.
customer_reviews.author: C. Travis Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Paint comes off beads!
customer_reviews.text: Paint comes off the wood!! I ordered this for my 5 month old who of course puts everything in his mouth. But when I opened the box some of the paint on the wooden beads had already rubbed off on the inside of the box. So no way was I going to give it to my baby to chew on! 0 stars if I could for that reason - had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel T

customer_reviews.title: Fun for baby
customer_reviews.text: This is fun and I love manhattan toy. I can’t remember if we gave ten or thirteen dollars for this but either way, I don’t feel it is quite worth that much. It does entertain my baby and I like wood toys and wood toys are expensive. I feel this is a decent size. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: 3 month and up! Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 month old loves this toy! It is easy for him to grasp. He loves chewing on it and rattling it! I have recommended it to other parents already! It’s is great how it flexes so he can hold it while rolling over etc. Only problem is he gets frustrated when he hits himself in the head with it while trying to put it in his mouth, but that happens with other toys too. This is by far his favorite toy though!
customer_reviews.author: erin

customer_reviews.title: Just a basic fun wood toy
customer_reviews.text: My child loves this. I love that there is no way he can get a lot of this in his mouth. It's as big as his head, and it's a wood toy. When it is shook it has a musical sound to it. It's easy to grasp and move about for my 4 month old. In the event your child face plants on this from a weak sitting position or just from rolling over this item does collapse and doesn't seem to leave any marks. Which is great as it makes the child move it around.
customer_reviews.author: Xu Hawj

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves this!
customer_reviews.text: Whatever magic this toy has in it our baby loves it! Great grasping toy and I feel good that its food grade paint hes chewing on. My husband complains that the knobs poke babys eyes when hes chewing (ok - so they do..one star off) but baby still loves it...
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Remakable toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for years in my daycares - until I could no longer find them. When I stumbled across this, I did not hesitate to purchase one for my 3 month old niece. It is easy to hold, stimulating through color and touch, durable, and it grows with the child in tha it is mashable. Super Product! I forgot to note that the beads are big.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Classic toy
customer_reviews.text: Every baby should have one of these. They last forever, endure child after child for years! I lost the last one I bought for my first grandson so I had to order a new one. My new baby grandson loves it as well (no surprise there.)
customer_reviews.author: Jan Mc

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Our 4-month-old has been loving this. She has been able to grab it on her own to check out and play with and puts it in her mouth now that she's teething. Plus it looks really cool. Probably the best toy we have for her right now.
customer_reviews.author: Morrison-Gills

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves this
customer_reviews.text: My five and a half month old loves this toy. He holds it easily and is always chewing on it. The different colors are also supposed to be good for their visual sensory development. It's a little complicated to clean and I'm always wiping it down but that's a small price to pay for our baby's favorite toy.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy! Dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy! The ball fell down itself after 3 months! My baby might suffocate!
customer_reviews.author: LAI YUE

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hold and nice colors
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves the color. It’s lightweight. Really easy to hold. It doesn’t seem like he likes to teeth on it but I still have my hopes that he will give this toy more attention. I also bought the same but in a different color for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Barboza

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy for my 7 month old! It is very easy for him to grab on to. However, I would not purchase this toy for the sole purpose of teeth. The balls are made of wood. I do love this toy though and so does my baby!
customer_reviews.author: Lark Herrig

customer_reviews.title: Grows with your baby!
customer_reviews.text: My five month old has been in love with this product since we got it for him at two months old. He first loved staring at it and listening as the little wooden pieces moved when we turned it, now he loves how easy it is to grab and shove in his mouth! Definitely grows with your baby which is great!
customer_reviews.author: Ceara Chirovsky

customer_reviews.title: To each his own.
customer_reviews.text: As much I loved this toy, my son hardly did much with it. The longest any one time he spent with it was probably 30 seconds. I did what I could to encourage interaction with it, but he was happier with something else. I guess this is one of those some-take-to-it-while-others-do-not.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great for developing find motor skills and for teething !
customer_reviews.text: I prefer non painted would but my 3 month old LOVES this thing. It holds his attention longer than any other toy. Also love that it’s appropriate for a large age category so he won’t lose interest when he’s able to engage for with objects. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful well-made toy
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this toy! We got it for him at three months and he loved looking at it. I would turn it around and shake it so that he could see the different colors. He’s now 6 months old and loves to hold it and chew on the little balls. It’s constructed very well and is a beautiful toy. It’s one of our favorites!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Paint chipped after a couple months
customer_reviews.text: Baby really loved this toy, constantly chewing on it and playing. But I had to take it away because paint and splinters started chipping off of it. Planning to get a non-colored one to see if it will work out better.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory Minter-Mohr

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS TOY!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this toy! saw it on a recommended list of toys and as soon as my daughter reached for it she was hooked! she gets excited and tends to bonk herself with it here and there, but she is learning how to use her hands as well as cause/effect so this was really a blessing! she loves being able to hold it and squish it while chewing on it :-)
customer_reviews.author: YoJoJo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to grab, great quality
customer_reviews.text: I love that is is wooden, colorful, non-toxic, and engaging. Makes a rattle noise when you shake it as the little wooden balls moves around, and you can also move those manually. It collapses when squeezed to fit in the diaper bag. Our 4 month old shakes it and can grab it easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mindee J. Plugues

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy this toy. The rattling. The squishing. The colors. The movement. Gave it for stars because we only give it to our daughter when we are close by, if she falls on it from sitting it is not a very comfortable landing. But all in all would recommend this toy. She really enjoys it. Great for sitting in the shopping cart cuz it can’t fall through the leg holes.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Instant baby hit!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a present for a 3 month old, I think the mother was a little sceptical about the size (it was the size of the baby's head if not bigger) and it looks like there are little bits that can be choked on. However, the elastic between the rods prevent it from going in the baby's mouth too far. In the end, I opened it that day it was an instant hit. It's very light, makes rattle sounds, chewable and great for developing fine motor skills and still usable beyond 12 months. I will definitely buy this as a present for other young babies.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: A great toy and a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: A very cute toy and one that every baby I've ever seen play with it loves it. It's made out of brightly painted wood and black elastic cords. This is the new version that does NOT have the bell that past versions have had. This toy is highly durable and gives baby many hours of stimulation. One my favorite parts is that when the wooden beads move up and down the rods, they make an almost musical noise. My babies' favorite part was the fact that it can change shape when squish it, something that always amazed them!
customer_reviews.author: Suzy

customer_reviews.title: Love/Hate Relationshp
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this a 5 even though my 5-month old has a love/hate relationship with this toy. He can clutch this toy very easily and loves the noise, and balls at the end. However, his aim is still not perfected and so ends up poking his eye with the ball and gets frustrated. Although, he will end up going for the toy even though he knows sometimes he'll accidently hurt himself with it. What can you do! He also has gotten his hand stuck in the toy and not been able to dislodge that easily. Even with all these concerns as a mother, my son still really likes it.
customer_reviews.author: George Vartanian

customer_reviews.title: Fun colorful toy
customer_reviews.text: My son enjoys this toy for the colors and sounds. He also likes to compress it into different shapes. My only reserve is with round ends, they seem secure but not sure how long they will hold up with baby teething on them.
customer_reviews.author: Trav

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: After just two months, we discovered that one of the elastic strings frayed. This posed a serious danger to our baby grandson. I'm just glad we saw it before it hurt the 4 month old. He loves the toy. We are very disappointed that it fell apart so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: A favorite baby toy
customer_reviews.text: This was a favorite of my kids, and have now purchased several for grandkids. The adults and older kids end up using them for fidget toys as much as the babies use them. There is just something hypnotic about the design. I miss the versions with the bells but assume they were deemed a choking hazard.
customer_reviews.author: atty64

customer_reviews.title: Great option for those teething
customer_reviews.text: This toy is a fun and colorful one, although my son perhaps is not big enough (introduced at 3 months - he is 6 months now) to enough it thoroughly as he looses his attention on it quickly, like after just a minute. He does enjoy gnawing on it to help soothe those gums though and I'm for anything natural that goes in their mouth. I like how it makes noise when you shake it, that does always gets his attention.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Baby Toy - Made in Thailand
customer_reviews.text: My son really loves this baby toy and I recommend it for anyone who thinks a child in their life would like this toy. Made in Thailand
customer_reviews.author: Sunny & Tony

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not a teething toy!
customer_reviews.text: Not a teething toy at all. It’s cute but I am not sure what all the hype is about. Thankful I got it on sale and didn’t pay full price!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria S.

customer_reviews.title: Color comes off
customer_reviews.text: Got it got my 5 month old but as I took out the wooden toy, you can see the paint color had started coming off in the packaging box. Can't let him chew on it 🙄 don't want him swallowing paint or have a colorful mouth! But so easy for him to grab and play with it.... Too bad!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great new toy!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic choice for my child with disabilities! Lightweight and easy to use for him. He has muscular atrophy and this encourages him to move his hands.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Knutson

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My son (5 months) got this for Christmas from his grandma and completely loves it. Easy to grab, chew on, wave around, toss. It's wood but the elastic helps prevent it hurting when tossed around. My dogs destroyed the original one we got so we had to order a second.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: too basic for 6 month old baby
customer_reviews.text: Good construction, colors and design, but purchased a little late in my baby's development. My six month old was not interested in playing with this toy. She had learnt already to pass items between hands and hold them with two hands ( the silicone Life Factory teething rings helped a lot with that), but I thought this object would encourage finer motor skills, as there are strings and beads to touch. She would bang this toy, but would prefer other rattles. Now at 8 months she has better fine motor skills but is still not interested on the toy.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten this toy for several kids. Great for babies hand/eye coordination. Most have had it as a favorite toy. My son played with his for well over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Jess C

customer_reviews.title: not as favorite and he loved to shake it and hit himself ...
customer_reviews.text: My son's first toy was another Manhattan Toy rubber type rattle/teether and that thing is solid gold. It was the first toy he could hold onto and play with and it was in his hands for months. This one, not as favorite and he loved to shake it and hit himself in the head, and the balls worried me hitting himself in the eye.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dip

customer_reviews.title: A nice, gentle baby toy with no batteries
customer_reviews.text: A nice, gentle baby toy with no batteries! The beads that run back and forth across the elastic make a nice, soft, non-annoying noise that baby (and I!) likes. Tt's very easy for him to grab, shake, squish, and pull. He loves chewing on the beads on the ends of the rods as well. We had one of these for my older son years ago that we lost, and I knew I needed to get one for the new baby!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: You will play with it too ...
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed, interesting toy for baby. Fun for teething, flexible so no one gets impaled, really nice that they can see how the sounds are made by the beads moving. Ends are securely attached, smooth finish, colorful, and fun
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy at daycare so I got one for the house. She loves it! Simple but great toy. She loves putting it in her mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I was really hesitant to buy this because I wasn’t sure if my son would like it. It’s his go to toy. He’s 4 months old and is able to grab it and shake it easily. It’s bendable so if he sticks it in his mouth I don’t have to worry about him hurting himself. It’s also great for teething! It’s the only teether he’s able to easily grab and move to his mouth. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Super fun!
customer_reviews.text: Our baby absolutely loved this toy! It's light weight with lots of thin areas for small hands which makes it very easy to grab. It's also super colorful which is interesting and fun for babies to look at. Even as an adult I want to play with it!
customer_reviews.author: Heather G.

customer_reviews.title: baby loves it but she kept hitting her eye with one end of rattle ball
customer_reviews.text: giving a four star because I think the design of rattle could be improved to smaller size. My baby kept hitting her eye with with the opposite edge she's biting. We took the rattle away since her eyelid was becoming redish./blue- but ultimately she loved it especially for teething and helping her to grasp onto things.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: A staple toy for baby
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this toy. She has played with it since she was 2.5 months and she's in the 15% growth percentile. My cousins kids both had this toy and loved it so I knew to get it. It's easy for them to grasp. They gum at the rounded edges. Also the parts move inside and make a nice noise for them to play with. They also really really loved the rhino toy ball. The rhino ball was the first ball toy I bought and one of the first toys she would ever play with because it is so easy for them to grasp. I would recommend both toys to have.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: This is the BEST baby toy on the market
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST baby toy on the market. I discovered it twenty years ago when I was a nanny and the 5month old in my care played with it endlessly. I have easily purchased 30 of them and make a point of giving one out to every baby born in my life. The classic colors are my favorite though I have purchased the wooden ones and the pastel one. The best part is the parents love holding it in theirs hands and playing with it too!! If you can get it out of the adults hands the baby will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Jodella

customer_reviews.title: Great first toy!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is the absolute best! My son is 3 months old and is able to pick it up and move it around. He can grab the toy easily by the strings and bring it to his mouth. He loves shaking it. It's the first toy he's shown any interest in. I think because its so easy to grab. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Kincaid

customer_reviews.title: Fun Toy that Plagues my Occasional OCD
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite toys. I love the sound it makes when the wooden balls slide back and forth. My baby is able to grasp it from many points. She is six-months-old. One thing I don't like (though it does not affect the use at all) is that it has become a little mis-shaped from being squished a certain way. I think it is just the elastic cord being distributed unevenly. Again, it is just an appearance thing and it does not affect the function.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Best darn Rattle on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first rattle like this when my kids were babies. 25 years later ( and 4 kids) we still have the rattle. The elastic is a little stretched out (OK, way stretched out). So time for a new on for the Grand-kids. This rattle is good for hours of fun and enjoyment. Simply the best rattle. Can fall on it, step on it, sit on it. Snaps back to shape and darn hard to get hurt with.
customer_reviews.author: tell family

customer_reviews.title: Actually, my wife uses it as a desktop chachka
customer_reviews.text: My wife has had all her teeth for decades, so I can't comment on teething It is rather easy to hold She's not had to clean it in the couple of years she's had it.
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: kids love these
customer_reviews.text: The best little toy an infant can hang on to. Both my grand kids loved even when they were older because they loved how the way the wood beads slid on the wood dowels between the larger beads. The whole thing is flexible with an elastic that has gone through 2 grandchildren, rough grandchildren at that! One loved to suck on one of the larger knobs for extended periods of time and it looks none the worse for wear. I highly recommend this since they were always a favorite toy.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Lee Carman

customer_reviews.title: Montessori toy
customer_reviews.text: It’s my daughter’s favorite toy. It teaches her to grasp with her hand. The wood are painted with non-toxic paint.
customer_reviews.author: Orkiks

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Have been purchasing these for almost 30 years! Now a gramma, we love the dynamic design for the baby!
customer_reviews.author: Castle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hold and teeth on!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 month old loves this! She's fascinated by it, loves teething on the end balls and it's super easy for her to hold on to! Bonus that I can totally tell it will grow with her and she'll continue enjoying it, I even think it's pretty neat!
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: It’s very sturdy and nicely made however my 6m old don’t show any interest in it. That was why I returned it. Other than that, I think it’s worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nur

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This toy is really cute and my baby loves holding it but it is not easy to clean since I have to wait for the elastic to fully dry off before giving it to my baby
customer_reviews.author: Ilcy Rivera

customer_reviews.title: My baby’s favorite toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much the only toy my five month old is REALLY interested in. This will keep her occupied all through church and bible study and doctor appointments and store visits xD
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Lane

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy!
customer_reviews.text: My little guy isn't here yet, but I'm really hoping he loves this toy as much as I do! It's very unique and a nice construction. Would make a great gift as well!
customer_reviews.author: Molly P

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy for baby!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy as a gift for a friend's baby because my son had one when he was a baby and loved it. It provided a lot of entertainment for him at the time and he loved grasping the balls and the rods, as well as the cords. He would also put it in his mouth and slobber on it when he was teething. It was a great toy for him and that is why I thought it'd be a great gift for a new baby!
customer_reviews.author: MJO

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: One of babies favorite toys already (at 4 months old) easy for young ones to hold and makes a nice little noise.
customer_reviews.author: BMF5545

customer_reviews.title: fun toy
customer_reviews.text: This toy has the balls that move on the rods and elastic bands that hold the points together. If you push down on the toy it folds down flat (as the elastic stretches) but then pops back into shape. So far with over 10 months of biting & playing it is holding strong. I knocked it a star only because I do worry about the wood cracking/breaking and worry about the baby falling on this and whacking his eye. That might be because I'm over-protective but that's why it isn't 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Szu

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves this! He holds it with his feet and hands. He loves to shake it and hear the noises it makes.
customer_reviews.author: Crazydoglady

customer_reviews.title: Usefulness and entertainment- Not!
customer_reviews.text: Based on the reviews I thought my little one would enjoy using the skwish to play with or use as a teether as it’s headlined to be. Though she wasn’t as amused I thought she would be. She’s enjoyed chewing on cheap silicone teethers instead.
customer_reviews.author: ❤️

customer_reviews.title: This was recommended to us by our son's occupational therapist
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to us by our son's occupational therapist. This has kept him entertained on countless car rides, and helped him develop his hand coordination. I got it for him when he was about 4 months old and he is still using it at 1 year. He likes to gnaw on it and pull the stretchy strings. It gets used heavily and has never fallen apart, and none of the strings have snapped or come undone.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Wilson

customer_reviews.title: You must have this toy for your kid
customer_reviews.text: It's a great toy that I recommend to every mom!
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Saw this toy ..just had to get it for my grandson
customer_reviews.text: I watched my 9 month old little nephew play with a Skwish at an overnight family reunion...and realized what a terrific toy it is for a small child...easy to pick-up and hold (light weight & easy to grip) and fun to play with (making noise each time the balls shift position). Just had to get one for my newest grandson...so, I searched until I found the manufacturer Manhattan Toys. It arrived quickly and became a big hit. He loves the noise, the colors, the easy grip & hold, and watching the balls move. Manhattan Toys has many neat things for little .
customer_reviews.author: Pepper

customer_reviews.title: Babies like it
customer_reviews.text: My twins have liked this toy off and on for months. When they were just a couple months old I would hold it up and show them colors and make it rattle. As they got a little older I had to put it away for a month or so because they kept hurting themselves as they shook it around. But now we've had it out for a few months again and they like it. The elastic is really strong, so it is hard for the babies to squish it flat, but they still like to shake it around and suck on any piece they can get in their mouths.
customer_reviews.author: Robin P.

customer_reviews.title: Easy for baby to grasp
customer_reviews.text: One of the best baby toys! This was my daughter’s favorite toy from 4-8 months. It was really easy for her to hold onto. And it makes a nice gentle rattle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected disappointment
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this item for my daughter's 6 month old twins I was very happy with the quality of the product and I thought the sounds the wooden beads make and the elasticity of the toy would be a sure hit. It is very easy for them to hold and the colors of the beads are beautiful but so far they are not interested in it. They have held it and tried to chew on it but quickly become bored. I am still hoping they may become interested though so am holding out for that to happen perhaps when they're a bit older.
customer_reviews.author: golf123

customer_reviews.title: ... toy that your child with play with as a favorite for years
customer_reviews.text: This is a delightful toy that your child with play with as a favorite for years, from early infant grasping and shaking to more complex play "skwishing" (collapsing) the rods on the surprisingly sturdy stretchy lines that hold the toy together, then rolling it, pushing and pulling other small toys into the center of it, and so on as your toddler's world of experience expands. The color and shape of the toy catch immediate attention -- a lovely little artwork in and of itself. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hurtado

customer_reviews.title: Very cute and looks like fun for my 5 1/2 mo
customer_reviews.text: Very cute and looks like fun for my 5 1/2 mo. old granddaughter. It's a Christmas gift. I played with it a bit. It springs back up after collapsing it. I suppose that the strings make grabbing it quite easy for a 4-6 month old. It is very sturdy and the strings are really cords and not in the least able to be bitten and broken. I was concerned about that. It is quite colorful, so I'm sure it will attract a 5 month old. If it doesn't go over, I will update and let you all know!
customer_reviews.author: SomeoneWhoCares

customer_reviews.title: Easy to grip. Perfect for little ones still learning hand-eye coordination!
customer_reviews.text: All three of my children loved this toy as an infant!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Whittle

customer_reviews.title: High quality toy
customer_reviews.text: Our 4-month old is extremely fascinated with it and used it initially to balance herself while trying to sit. The flexibility is great for this, the disadvantage is that her hand gets stuck occasionally. Overall a great product but requires parental supervision.
customer_reviews.author: Jasper

customer_reviews.title: No interesting enough for my Grandbaby idky????
customer_reviews.text: This toy doesn’t interest my granddaughter for some reason idk😤🤔🤔🤔🤔🤔
customer_reviews.author: Karen C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 4 months and up
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves his squish! Great item and great price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great baby toy
customer_reviews.text: easy to grasp and nice that it collapses when your little one smacks themselves with it. We have twin 6 month olds, and they both love this toy that I got two. recommend the colored one, much more interesting and as one reviewer states there is a clear coat of something on the plain one, so if it is toxic my guess is that they are pretty equal. That said the design makes it rather hard to really suck on (although they try)
customer_reviews.author: K. Breit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to learn to play and grab things
customer_reviews.text: Amazing toy for every little one. Perfect for their dexterity
customer_reviews.author: alex demers

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: My sons arm got stuck in this last week and he was screaming bloody murder. Be careful
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: It is not as good as I thought.
customer_reviews.text: I would like to return this toy. My son doesn't want to touch it. I think it looks like if it had life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This toy was perfect for my theething 6 month old, he is now 9 months old and he is still using it and it's held up.
customer_reviews.author: Mitsy

customer_reviews.title: Very happy 4 month old!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my daughter's FAVORITE toy. She is almost 4 months and started playing with it a couple weeks ago.. she falls asleep holding it, chews on it and it can really calm her down when she's fussy! It's easy for her to hold by herself and she maneuvers it quite well by herself. I absolutely LOVE this toy and most anything I buy from this brand!
customer_reviews.author: Angelica and Joe

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun places for baby to hold and chew on
customer_reviews.text: Baby loves chomping on the balls, and this was one of the earliest toys he was able to hold and enjoy, along with the Manhattan Toys Winkel--there are so many fun places to hold onto! The sliding balls add interest and make a soft, pleasant wooden sound. I was worried when ordering this about its sturdiness, but it appears strong and well-made. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MWT

product_meta.title: Manhattan Toy Skwish Classic Rattle and Teether Grasping Activity Toy
product_meta.description: Keep your baby entertained for hours with this brightly-colored Skwish rattle from Manhattan Toy. Made up of rods, large wooden beads and sturdy strings, this classic toy allows your baby to bend and stretch it into different shapes. When your child lets it go, it pops back into its original shape. The constant movement of the Skwish rattle creates visual stimulation and helps develop motor skills. Since 1979, Manhattan Toy has been making award-winning, high quality, educational toys for your baby, toddler or kid. From baby toys and toddler toys to wooden toys and activity centers, our goal is to provide the safest and best toys available. All of our products, from the newest concepts to our time-tested classics, are innovatively designed to inspire imaginative play and are routinely safety tested to pass strict CPSC, ASTM, EN71 and Health Canada safety standards.
feature_bullets: Classic wooden clutching motor skill and baby toy for ages 0 months and up
Skwish is easy for little hands to grasp while rattling the beads that slide back and forth on dowels
Wood construction with elastic ties allow rattle and teether to flatten, or "Skwish", and always return to its original shape
Baby rattle and teether carefully constructed of sustainable wood with a non-toxic, water based finish
Skwish rattles and teethers from Manhattan Toy have been an awarding winning favorite of both babies and parents for over 35 years
